about.name: Shweta Pandey
about.title: PhD Student, Indian Institute of Science (IISc)
about.bio: I am a PhD student at IISc working on high-performance systems that span heterogeneous compute and memory hierarchies—focusing on GPU-accelerated storage, persistence, and inference. My research explores architectural and software techniques to optimize GPU performance across storage engines, database systems, and large-model inference.

experience.description: Research in GPU-accelerated storage systems, databases, and persistent memory with a focus on end-to-end performance optimization across heterogeneous memory and compute resources.
Worked on improving the throughput of text-to-image generation models by optimizing diffusion transformer pipelines using architectural and software-level techniques.
Built a chatbot system for an airline using NLP techniques for parsing, intent recognition, and response generation.

projects.name: H-Rocks
projects.description: A performance-optimized version of RocksDB for hybrid storage. Accelerates memtable, WAL, and compaction using GPU offloading.

projects.name: HyCache
projects.description: Hybrid CPU-GPU caching layer for fast DNN input pipelines. Focuses on preprocessing and memory hierarchy utilization.

projects.name: GPM
projects.description: Enables GPU access to persistent memory with a custom programming model and persistency protocol.

projects.name: SBPM (Scoped Buffered Persistency Models)
